resources.name: Get all characters
resources.description:
[Get all characters](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-all-characters)

You can access the list of characters by using the `/character` endpoint.

resources.name: Character
resources.description:
There is a total of `671` characters sorted by id.

## Character Schema

| Key      | Type         | Description                                                                                                                                   |
|----------|--------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| id       | int          | The id of the character.                                                                                                                      |
| name     | string       | The name of the character.                                                                                                                    |
| status   | string       | The status of the character ('Alive', 'Dead' or 'unknown').                                                                                   |
| species  | string       | The species of the character.                                                                                                                 |
| type     | string       | The type or subspecies of the character.                                                                                                      |
| gender   | string       | The gender of the character ('Female', 'Male', 'Genderless' or 'unknown').                                                                    |
| origin   | object       | Name and link to the character's origin location.                                                                                             |
| location | object       | Name and link to the character's last known location endpoint.                                                                                |
| image    | string (url) | Link to the character's image. All images are 300x300px and most are medium shots or portraits since they are intended to be used as avatars. |
| episode  | array (urls) | List of episodes in which this character appeared.                                                                                            |
| url      | string (url) | Link to the character's own URL endpoint.                                                                                                     |
| created  | string       | Time at which the character was created in the database.                                                                                      |

resources.name: REST
resources.description:
Base url: `https://rickandmortyapi.com/api`

The `baseUrl` contains information about all available API's resources. All requests are `GET` requests and go over `https`. All responses will return data in `json`.

resources.name: Rick and Morty API
resources.description: The [Rick and Morty API](https://rickandmortyapi.com/) is a RESTful and GraphQL API based on the television show Rick and Morty. You will access data about hundreds of characters, images, locations and episodes.

resources.name: Get a single character
resources.description:
[Get a single character](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-a-single-character)

You can get a single character by adding the `id` as a parameter: `/character/2`

resources.name: Get multiple characters
resources.description:
[Get multiple characters](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-multiple-characters)

You can get multiple characters by adding an array of `ids` as parameter: `/character/[1,2,3]` or `/character/1,2,3`

resources.name: Filter characters
resources.description:
[Filter characters](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#filter-characters)

You can also include filters in the URL by including additional query parameters. To start filtering add a `?` followed by the query `<query>=<value>`. If you want to chain several queries in the same call, use `&` followed by the query.

For example, If you want to check how many alive Ricks exist, just add `?name=rick&status=alive` to the URL.

Available parameters:

- `name`: filter by the given name.
- `status`: filter by the given status (alive, dead or unknown).
- `species`: filter by the given species.
- `type`: filter by the given type.
- `gender`: filter by the given gender (female, male, genderless or unknown).

resources.name: Get all locations
resources.description:
[Get all locations](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-all-locations)

You can access the list of locations by using the `/location` endpoint.

resources.name: Location
resources.description:
There is a total of `108` locations sorted by id.

## Location schema
| Key       | Type         | Description                                                |
|-----------|--------------|------------------------------------------------------------|
| id        | int          | The id of the location.                                    |
| name      | string       | The name of the location.                                  |
| type      | string       | The type of the location.                                  |
| dimension | string       | The dimension in which the location is located.            |
| residents | array (urls) | List of character who have been last seen in the location. |
| url       | string (url) | Link to the location's own endpoint.                       |
| created   | string       | Time at which the location was created in the database.    |

resources.name: Get single location
resources.description:
[Get a single location](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-a-single-location)

You can get a single location by adding the `id` as a parameter: `/location/3`

resources.name: Get multiple locations
resources.description:
[Get multiple locations](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-multiple-locations)

You can get multiple locations by adding an array of `ids` as parameter: `/location/[1,2,3]` or `/location/1,2,3`

resources.name: Filter locations
resources.description:
[Filter locations](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#filter-locations)

Available parameters:

- `name`: filter by the given name.
- `type`: filter by the given type.
- `dimension`: filter by the given dimension.
- If you want to know how to use queries, check [here](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#filter-characters)

resources.name: Get all episodes
resources.description:
[Get all episodes](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-all-episodes)

You can access the list of episodes by using the `/episode` endpoint.

resources.name: Episode
resources.description:
There is a total of `41` episodes sorted by id (which is of course the order of the episodes)

## Episode schema

| Key      | Type         | Description                                                                                                                                   |
|----------|--------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| id       | int          | The id of the character.                                                                                                                      |
| name     | string       | The name of the character.                                                                                                                    |
| status   | string       | The status of the character ('Alive', 'Dead' or 'unknown').                                                                                   |
| species  | string       | The species of the character.                                                                                                                 |
| type     | string       | The type or subspecies of the character.                                                                                                      |
| gender   | string       | The gender of the character ('Female', 'Male', 'Genderless' or 'unknown').                                                                    |
| origin   | object       | Name and link to the character's origin location.                                                                                             |
| location | object       | Name and link to the character's last known location endpoint.                                                                                |
| image    | string (url) | Link to the character's image. All images are 300x300px and most are medium shots or portraits since they are intended to be used as avatars. |
| episode  | array (urls) | List of episodes in which this character appeared.                                                                                            |
| url      | string (url) | Link to the character's own URL endpoint.                                                                                                     |
| created  | string       | Time at which the character was created in the database.                                                                                      |

resources.name: Get a single episode
resources.description:
[Get a single episode](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-a-single-episode)

You can get a single episode by adding the `id` as a parameter: `/episode/28`

resources.name: Get multiple episodes
resources.description:
[Get multiple episodes](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#get-multiple-episodes)

You can get multiple episodes by adding an array of `ids` as parameter: `/episode/[1,2,3]` or `/episode/1,2,3`

resources.name: Filter episodes
resources.description:
[Filter episodes](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#filter-episodes)

Available parameters:

- `name`: filter by the given name.
- `episode`: filter by the given episode code.
- If you want to know how to use queries, check [here](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#filter-characters).

resources.name: Resources
resources.description:
The base url contains information about all available API's resources. All requests are `GET` requests and go over `https`. All responses will return data in `json`.

There are currently three available resources:

- [Character](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#character): used to get all the characters.
- [Location](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#location): used to get all the locations.
- [Episode](https://rickandmortyapi.com/documentation/#episode): used to get all the episodes.

resources.name: GraphQL
